text.p: The U.S. Defense National Stockpile Center said Wednesday it sold a total of 36,000 short tons of ferrochromium to two companies, Macalloy Corp. of North Charleston, South Carolina and Metallurg International Resources of New York.
The sales were made under long-term contracts with an approximate total current market value of $17.8 million, the agency said.
Separately, the Stockpile also said it sold no vanadium pentoxide in its monthly offer.
